definitions.definition: To fall in droplets (of a liquid).
To drip (a liquid).
definitions.example: The equipment shows how much the glacier has moved and the amount it dropped in height over the summer.

definitions.definition: Generally, to fall (straight down).
definitions.example: A single shot was fired and the bird dropped from the sky.

definitions.definition: To let fall; to allow to fall (either by releasing hold of, or losing one's grip on).
definitions.example: Don't drop that plate!   The police ordered the men to drop their weapons.

definitions.definition: To let drops fall; to discharge itself in drops.
To lower; to move to a lower position.
To set down from a vehicle; to deliver or deposit by stopping.
definitions.example: Could you drop me at the airport on your way to work tomorrow?

definitions.definition: To sink quickly to the ground.
definitions.example: Drop and give me thirty push-ups, private!

definitions.definition: To fall dead, or to fall in death.
To come to an end (by not being kept up); to stop.
To mention casually or incidentally, usually in conversation.
definitions.example: The moderator would drop hints whenever the students struggled.

definitions.definition: To part with or spend (money).
To cease concerning oneself over; to have nothing more to do with (a subject, discussion etc.).
definitions.example: I'm tired of this subject. Will you just drop it?

definitions.definition: To lessen, decrease, or diminish in value, condition, degree, etc.
definitions.example: The stock dropped 1.5% yesterday.   We can take our vacation when the price of fuel drops.   Watch for the temperature to drop sharply, then you'll know the reaction is complete.

definitions.definition: To let (a letter etc.) fall into a postbox; to send (a letter or message) in an offhand manner.
definitions.example: Drop me a note when you get to the city.

definitions.definition: To make (someone or something) fall to the ground from a blow, gunshot etc.; to bring down, to shoot down.
definitions.example: Make any sudden movements and I will drop you!

definitions.definition: To fail to write, or (especially) to pronounce (a syllable, letter etc.).
definitions.example: Cockneys drop their aitches.

definitions.definition: (of a fielder) To fail to make a catch from a batted ball that would have led to the batsman being out.
definitions.example: Warne dropped Tendulkar on 99. Tendulkar went on to get a century next ball

definitions.definition: To swallow (a drug), particularly LSD.
definitions.example: They had never dropped acid.

definitions.definition: To dispose (of); get rid of; to remove; to lose.
definitions.example: I dropped ten pounds and an obnoxious fiancée.

definitions.definition: To eject; to dismiss; to cease to include, as if on a list.
definitions.example: I've been dropped from the football team.

definitions.definition: To drop out of the betting.
(rugby football) To score (a goal) by means of a drop kick.
To impart.
definitions.example: I drop knowledge wherever I go.

definitions.definition: To release to the public.
definitions.example: That hacker has been threatening to drop my docs [i.e. publish my personal information].

definitions.definition: To play a portion of music in the manner of a disc jockey.
definitions.example: I love it when he drops his funky beats.

definitions.definition: To enter public distribution.
definitions.example: "Hip-Hop Xmas" dropped in time for the holidays.

definitions.definition: To tune (a guitar string, etc.) to a lower note.
To cancel or end a scheduled event, project or course.
definitions.example: I had to drop calculus because it was taking up too much of my time and I couldn't go anymore.

definitions.definition: (fast food) To cook, especially by deep-frying or grilling.
definitions.example: Drop a basket of fries.

definitions.definition: (of a voice) To lower in timbre, often relating to puberty.
definitions.example: Billy's voice dropped suddenly when he turned 12.

definitions.definition: (of a sound or song) To lower in pitch, tempo, key, or other quality.
definitions.example: My synthesizer makes the notes sound funny when they drop below C2.

definitions.definition: (of people) To visit informally; used with in or by.
definitions.example: Do drop by soon and I'll lend you that book.

definitions.definition: To give birth to.
definitions.example: to drop a lamb

definitions.definition: To cover with drops; to variegate; to bedrop.
(of the testicles) To hang lower and begin producing sperm due to puberty.
Something dropped.
(usually in the plural) A piece of animal excrement; dung.
definitions.example: a rabbit dropping

definitions.definition: The act of something that drops or falls.
